newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
title: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal to injury in Villarreal win

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: Real Madrid defender Dani Carvajal suffered what looked to be a serious knee injury in their LaLiga win against Villarreal, coach Carlo Ancelotti said on Saturday, after the Spanish champions recovered their winning touch.

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: Real beat Villarreal 2-0 to bounce back after two games without a victory, having lost 1-0 at Lille in the Champions League on Wednesday and being held to a 1-1 draw at Atletico Madrid in their previous league game.

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: But the defending champions were dealt a blow in stoppage time when Carvajal's screams of pain were heard and the stadium went silent as the right-back needed to be carried away on a stretcher.

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: LaLiga - Real Madrid v Villarreal - Santiago Bernabeu, Madrid, Spain - Oct 5, 2024 Real Madrid's Dani Carvajal receives medical attention after sustaining an injury REUTERS/Susana Vera

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: LaLiga - Real Madrid v Villarreal - Santiago Bernabeu, Madrid, Spain - Oct 5, 2024 Real Madrid's Dani Carvajal receives medical attention after sustaining an injury REUTERS/Susana Vera

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: "It looks like a pretty serious knee injury, the dressing room is sad and worried," Ancelotti told a press conference.

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: "It's something that happens a lot of times because of the calendar and it's happened to a very important player for us."

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: Spain defender Carvajal, 32, got injured in a duel with Villarreal midfielder Yeremy Pino, when his right knee suffered an unnatural movement as the player stretched it upwards.

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: "He is a fundamental player for us because of his experience, seriousness," Ancelotti said.

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: "I've been talking to him and he's sad, but there's not much we can do. We are going to see the medical evaluation and think about him recovering. The doctor has told us that he has to do tests, but that it's a knee injury."

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: LaLiga - Real Madrid v Villarreal - Santiago Bernabeu, Madrid, Spain - Oct 5, 2024 Real Madrid's Vinicius Junior celebrates scoring their second goal REUTERS/Susana Vera

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: LaLiga - Real Madrid v Villarreal - Santiago Bernabeu, Madrid, Spain - Oct 5, 2024 Real Madrid's Vinicius Junior celebrates scoring their second goal REUTERS/Susana Vera

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: Six-time Champions League winner Carvajal, one of Real's key players, was sent to undergo medical tests right away with the injury possibly season-ending, Spanish media reported.

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: "We have Lucas Vazquez, but it's not the time to talk about this," Ancelotti added.

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: "We are going to wait and if the injury is serious we are going to manage the squad well and see who we put in this position. It will not be me."

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
description: Carvajal's injury is another blow to Real defence, who were without goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois against Villarreal after the Belgian keeper suffered an injury to the abductor of his left leg in the Atletico draw last weekend.

newsitem: Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
Real regain confidence, lose Carvajal in Villarreal win
Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
title: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery after cruciate ligament injury

newsitem: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
description: Real Madrid right back Dani Carvajal will undergo surgery after rupturing two ligaments and a tendon in his right leg, the LaLiga club said after the Spaniard was taken off on a stretcher during Saturday's 2-0 home win over Villarreal.

newsitem: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
description: The 32-year-old Spain international twisted his right knee during a duel with Villarreal midfielder Yeremy Pino in stoppage time.

newsitem: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
description: "Serious cruciate ligament injury confirmed, I'll have to undergo surgery and be off the field for a few months," Carvajal said on Instagram, where he also posted a picture of himself in an ambulance.

newsitem: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
description: "Looking forward to starting the recovery process and coming back like an animal. Thank you all for your messages, I feel very loved," he added.

newsitem: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
description: Real manager Carlo Ancelotti said he was concerned about Carvajal's injury, the latest blow for the Spanish side after they played without goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois, who suffered an abductor muscle injury against Atletico Madrid last weekend.

newsitem: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
description: In a statement on Sunday, Real said Carvajal had been "diagnosed with a ruptured anterior cruciate ligament, a ruptured external collateral ligament and a ruptured popliteal tendon in his right leg."

newsitem: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
description: Real later announced that they had extended Carvajal's contract until June 2026.

newsitem: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
description: "Real Madrid would like to show him all its support and affection and wishes him a speedy recovery so that we can enjoy his football on the pitch again as soon as possible," they said in a statement.

newsitem: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
description: The LaLiga club also said that Brazilian winger Vinicius Jr. had suffered a neck injury in the same match.

newsitem: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
description: Real are second in the standings, level on 21 points with leaders Barcelona, who visit 11th-placed Deportivo Alaves later on Sunday.

newsitem: Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
Real's Carvajal to undergo surgery
Lewandowski nets hat-trick as Barca beat Alaves
title: Lewandowski nets hat-trick as Barcelona beat Alaves 3-0

newsitem: Lewandowski nets hat-trick as Barca beat Alaves
description: Robert Lewandowski's first-half hat-trick guided LaLiga leaders Barcelona to a 3-0 win away at Deportivo Alaves on Sunday as the Polish striker extended his lead at the top of the league's scoring charts.

newsitem: Lewandowski nets hat-trick as Barca beat Alaves
description: Barcelona wasted no time in going in front when Lewandowski headed home from a Raphinha free kick in the seventh minute before the Brazilian winger provided another assist on a counter-attack for the 36-year-old striker to grab his second.

newsitem: Lewandowski nets hat-trick as Barca beat Alaves
description: Lewandowski completed his hat-trick in the 32nd minute for his 10th LaLiga goal in nine games this season, but despite their dominance Barcelona could not score another as Antonio Sivera stood strong in the Alaves goal with six saves.

newsitem: Lewandowski nets hat-trick as Barca beat Alaves
description: The victory moved Barcelona to 24 points, three points clear of rivals Real Madrid, while Alaves are 12th with 10 points.

newsitem: Lewandowski nets hat-trick as Barca beat Alaves
Lewandowski nets hat-trick as Barca beat Alaves
Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
title: Manchester United's Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after 0-0 draw at Villa

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag said he remained on the same page as the club's senior management team despite the team's worst start in the Premier League era following a 0-0 draw at Aston Villa on Sunday.

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: United are languishing in 14th place on eight points with two wins from nine games in all competitions and Sunday's match was clouded by media speculation about Ten Hag's future.

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: The club's senior leadership team -- co-owner Jim Ratcliffe, CEO Omar Berrada, sporting director Dan Ashworth and technical director Jason Wilcox -- watched on intently at Villa Park.

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: "We are all on board together, on one page, we know what we are working through it's a long-term process," Ten Hag said. "We have come through two very tough away games (including Thursday's 3-3 Europa League draw at Porto).

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: "This is a team, we showed the belief and faith we have."

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: A victory might have eased the pressure on Ten Hag, and captain Bruno Fernandes nearly earned one when his long-range free kick hit the bar in the second half. Marcus Rashford also forced Villa keeper Emi Martinez to make two excellent saves.

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: "We created loads of chances in our seven (Premier League) games but we have to step up," Ten Hag said.

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: "We have to take into consideration (striker Rasmus) Hojlund is returning, he's still coming up to full fitness. But others are stepping up. I was impressed by Rashford, also (Alejandro) Garnacho is so good and Antony at the end."

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: Ten Hag headed over to United's travelling fans after what must have felt like a victory to applaud their support while Duran Duran's "Hungry Like a Wolf" played on the loudspeakers.

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: United defender Jonny Evans noted the talk about Ten Hag's future affected the players, saying: "It's on our minds too."

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: While the Premier League does not resume until Oct 19 due to the international break, the scrutiny on Ten Hag will likely not diminish, with United's hierarchy set to hold their monthly meeting in London on Tuesday.

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
description: Ratcliffe said on Friday that the decision on Ten Hag's future is not his to make.

newsitem: Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
Ten Hag shrugs off pressure after draw at Villa
Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
title: Bayern's Kompany happy with performance after 3-3 draw in Frankfurt

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: Bayern Munich conceded a late equaliser for a 3-3 draw at Eintracht Frankfurt in the Bundesliga on Sunday but despite being caught on the break three times Bayern coach Vincent Kompany said he was happy with his team's effort.

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: Bayern have now failed to win any of their last three matches in all competitions after last week's draw at home to Bayer Leverkusen in the top flight and their midweek Champions League loss at Aston Villa.

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: "This was a tough game against a team that was second in the Bundesliga (before the match)," Kompany told a press conference after the points were shared in Frankfurt.

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: "When I look how the team worked and ran for each other it is a positive performance. We are all judged by results but my job is to see how we perform against some of the top teams in Germany and continue to improve.

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: "If we continue like this we will have a lot of wins," Kompany added.

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: Bayern enjoyed a strong start and took the lead before Eintracht struck twice to go 2-1 up.

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: The visitors increased the tempo again to move 3-2 in front with goals from Dayot Upamecano and Michael Olise before Omar Marmoush snatched a late equaliser for Eintracht with his second goal of the game.

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: All three Eintracht goals came from quick counter-attacks with the Bayern defence caught off guard.

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: "The way we approached the game I cannot say I am not proud of the team," said Kompany.

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: "I know you are all going to talk about the thee goals that we conceded. We always have to improve things step by step."

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: "There are things that are not perfect but I have to focus on the things we did well," said the coach, in his first season at Bayern.

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
description: The Bavarians now have 14 points and lead the standings on goal difference ahead of RB Leipzig, who were 1-0 winners at Heidenheim earlier on Sunday. Eintracht are third on 13.

newsitem: Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
Kompany happy after draw in Frankfurt
Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
title: Welbeck completes Brighton comeback win over Tottenham

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Brighton & Hove Albion staged a storming second-half comeback with Danny Welbeck sealing a 3-2 home win over Tottenham Hotspur in a topsy-turvy Premier League clash on Sunday.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Goals by Brennan Johnson and James Maddison gave a dominant Spurs side a thoroughly deserved 2-0 lead at the interval.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: But the game was turned upside down after the break as Tottenham's defence fell apart under pressure to concede three goals in the space of 18 minutes.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Yankuba Minteh pulled a goal back for the hosts three minutes after the restart before Georginio Rutter levelled from close range. Welbeck then headed Brighton's third after more flimsy defending by the visitors.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Brighton's first win in five league games lifted them above Spurs into sixth place in the table with 12 points from seven games, while Tottenham are in ninth spot on 10.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Premier League - Brighton & Hove Albion v Tottenham Hotspur - The American Express Community Stadium, Brighton, Britain - Oct 6, 2024 Brighton & Hove Albion's Danny Welbeck scores their third goal REUTERS/Toby Melville

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Premier League - Brighton & Hove Albion v Tottenham Hotspur - The American Express Community Stadium, Brighton, Britain - Oct 6, 2024 Brighton & Hove Albion's Danny Welbeck scores their third goal REUTERS/Toby Melville

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: When Johnson slotted in his sixth goal in six games from Dominic Solanke's pass to reward 23 minutes of total Tottenham control, the visitors were oozing with confidence.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Johnson, the first Tottenham player to score in six successive games since Harry Kane in 2019, could have added another before a sweeping Spurs move ended with Maddison's shot sneaking past at-fault Brighton keeper Bart Verbruggen.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Welbeck twice came close for Brighton before the interval but the hosts had been thoroughly outplayed by Ange Postecoglou's slick visitors.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: "First half was bitterly disappointing," Welbeck told Sky Sport. "The performance we put in was embarrassing and not something we want to be part of."

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Whatever was said at halftime by Brighton boss Fabian Hurzeler worked a treat as Brighton, with Pervis Estupinan on as a substitute, a completely different proposition.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Tottenham were napping as they failed to cut out a cross with Destiny Udogie's horrible miskick falling for Minteh who took a touch before driving a shot past Guglielmo Vicario.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Premier League - Brighton & Hove Albion v Tottenham Hotspur - The American Express Community Stadium, Brighton, Britain - Oct 6, 2024 Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou reacts Action Images via Reuters/Matthew Childs

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Premier League - Brighton & Hove Albion v Tottenham Hotspur - The American Express Community Stadium, Brighton, Britain - Oct 6, 2024 Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou reacts Action Images via Reuters/Matthew Childs

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: The goal rocked Tottenham and as the rain came down on the south coast, they fell to pieces.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Ten minutes later winger Kaoru Mitoma played a pass in to Rutter and with Tottenham's defenders failing to react he fired in Brighton's leveller.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: Brighton's winner summed up Tottenham's second-half display. Rutter should never have been able to deliver a cross from the right but showed far more desire than those trying to stop him and when the ball was delivered across the area Welbeck had the simplest of tasks to nod it into the net.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: "Fair to say that the second half was unacceptable and we paid a price for that," Postecoglou, who looked stunned at the final whistle, said. "We probably should have put it to bed in the first half.

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
description: "What we did in that second half is unacceptable and we got what we deserved."

newsitem: Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
Brighton shocks Spurs in 3-2 comeback
Barca's Torres suffers hamstring injury
title: Barcelona's Spain forward Ferran Torres suffers hamstring injury

newsitem: Barca's Torres suffers hamstring injury
description: Barcelona's Spain forward Ferran Torres has suffered a hamstring injury and will be out of action for an indefinite period, the LaLiga club said on Monday.

newsitem: Barca's Torres suffers hamstring injury
description: The 24-year-old will miss Spain's Nations League matches against Denmark on Saturday and Serbia next Tuesday, national team coach Luis de la Fuente confirmed.

newsitem: Barca's Torres suffers hamstring injury
description: Media reports said Ferran could be out for six to eight weeks after he picked up the injury in Barca's 3-0 win at Deportivo Alaves on Sunday where he limped off after five minutes.

newsitem: Barca's Torres suffers hamstring injury
description: "Tests carried out on Ferran Torres confirm that he has an injury to the biceps femoris muscle in his right thigh. His return to training will be dependent on his recovery," the Catalan club said.

newsitem: Barca's Torres suffers hamstring injury
description: Barcelona are navigating an injury crisis, with Dani Olmo, Gavi, Fermin Lopez, Andreas Christensen, Ronald Araujo, and goalkeeper Marc-Andre ter Stegen among the players sidelined.

newsitem: Barca's Torres suffers hamstring injury
description: "Ferran's injury is worrying. We don't have many options in attack," Barca manager Hansi Flick said on Sunday.

newsitem: Barca's Torres suffers hamstring injury
description: He has made 10 appearances for Barcelona this season.

newsitem: Barca's Torres suffers hamstring injury
Barca's Torres suffers hamstring injury
Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
title: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty but playing for Real Madrid

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: France captain Kylian Mbappe is facing criticism in his home country for skipping their upcoming Nations League games against Israel and Belgium while being available to play for Real Madrid.

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: The forward picked up a muscle injury last month but made his return to the pitch off the bench in his club's Champions League defeat at Lille last Wednesday.

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: France coach Didier Deschamps left Mbappe out of the squad he announced on Thursday, saying the 25-year-old lacked preparation, having played too few matches.

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: Mbappe started Real's LaLiga winover Villarreal on Saturday.

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: "Either you're injured, and you don't play with your club and you're not called up in the national team," former France international Maxime Bossis told French sports daily L'Equipe on Monday.

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: "But when you come off the bench in the Champions League and you start a league game, it makes things fuzzy. He's a special player. We've known that with Michel Platini, when we still wanted him with us when he was injured."

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: In a video released by the French Football Federation (FFF) on Monday, Deschamps said: "Kylian embodies a lot of things ... The interests of the clubs and the interests of the national teams inevitably diverge. We must also remember that the employer is the club, not the federation."

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: Mbappe's situation is more complicated because the former Paris St Germain player is the France captain after being handed the armband ahead of Antoine Griezmann, who last week announced his retirement from international football.

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: France, second in Group A, face Israel in Budapest on Thursday and travel to Belgium next Monday.

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: INTERIM CAPTAIN

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: "(The captaincy) is on my mind. But, as I do every time, the key is to discuss it with the players involved," coach Deschamps added.

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: "Obviously, with Kylian our captain, and Antoine, who was the vice-captain, both missing, it means there will definitely be others for these two matches."

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: Griezmann's commitment to Les Bleus was never in doubt as the Atletico Madrid forward played a record 84 consecutive matches for his country between 2017 and 2024.

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: "As a captain (Mbappe) must be an example for the fans, and he has not been," Fabien Bonnet, spokesperson for the Irresistibles Francais, the main France supporters' group, told L'Equipe.

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: "What emerges is that the real captain, Antoine Griezmann, is gone."

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: On choosing the skipper for the Nations League games, Deschamps said: "It’s more about if (I can find) certain players who can handle this responsibility in the moment without it affecting their behaviour or performance.

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
description: "That’s why it’s important for me to really know the players on a personal level - their character, their sensitivity -relative to the group."

newsitem: Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
Mbappe under fire for skipping France duty
Maguire sidelined after injury at Villa
title: Man Utd's Maguire sidelined for a few weeks after injury at Villa

newsitem: Maguire sidelined after injury at Villa
description: Manchester United will be without England international Harry Maguire for a few weeks after the centre back said on Tuesday that he picked up an injury in Sunday's draw at Aston Villa.

newsitem: Maguire sidelined after injury at Villa
description: Maguire went down clutching his calf late in the first half and the 31-year-old was withdrawn at the break.

newsitem: Maguire sidelined after injury at Villa
description: "Frustrated to pick up an injury at the weekend. Will be a few weeks on the sidelines for me but I'll come back stronger," Maguire wrote on Instagram.

newsitem: Maguire sidelined after injury at Villa
description: The defender, who was left out of the England squad for the upcoming internationals, is the latest player to join United's growing injury list.

newsitem: Maguire sidelined after injury at Villa
description: The other injured players include Luke Shaw, Tyrell Malacia, Mason Mount, Leny Yoro, Alejandro Garnacho, Noussair Mazraoui and Kobbie Mainoo.

newsitem: Maguire sidelined after injury at Villa
description: United are 14th in the standings with eight points after seven games with the club suffering their worst start to a season in the Premier League era.

newsitem: Maguire sidelined after injury at Villa
Maguire sidelined after injury at Villa
Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
title: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots for Belgium

newsitem: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
description: Belgium attacker Leandro Trossard is hoping to take his club form with Arsenal to the national team, after returning to the squad for the Nations League matches against Italy and France over the next week.

newsitem: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
description: Trossard is expected to fill the pivotal midfield role that injured Kevin De Bruyne usually plays for the Group A2 matches in Rome on Thursday and then home to France on Monday.

newsitem: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
description: "That hasn't been discussed with the coach yet, but that will become clear today or tomorrow," Trossard told a press conference on Tuesday.

newsitem: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
description: "I don't know yet what position I will play but it's always nice to be played in your best position. At the European Championship, for example, I had to fill many roles."

newsitem: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
description: Trossard said he prefers being on the left side of the attack but Jeremy Doku is expected to fill that role. In the absence of De Bruyne, Trossard looks set to be used centrally by coach Domenico Tedesco.

newsitem: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
description: At Arsenal in recent matches, after injury to captain Martin Odegaard, he has played successfully as a second attacker alongside Kai Havertz.

newsitem: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
description: "I feel good, yes," Trossard said. "Is this my best form ever? I dare not say but I think I’m performing quite consistently at Arsenal."

newsitem: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
description: The 29-year-old Trossard is back in the squad after a surprise omission for last month’s Nations League games against Israel and France.

newsitem: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
description: Tedesco had called him beforehand to ask him to sit out the pair of matches.

newsitem: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
description: "He said he knew my qualities, wanted to try out new guys and give them some experience. The Nations League offers the opportunity for that. I agreed to that. It was a good agreement."

newsitem: Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
Trossard aiming to fill De Bruyne's boots
Palmer voted England fans’ Player of the Year
title: Chelsea’s Palmer voted England fans' Player of the Year

newsitem: Palmer voted England fans’ Player of the Year
description: Cole Palmer has been named the 2023-24 England men's Player of the Year, the Football Association said on Tuesday.

newsitem: Palmer voted England fans’ Player of the Year
description: Chelsea midfielder Palmer, 22, was voted Three Lions' fans' favourite player ahead of Real Madrid midfielder Jude Bellingham, in second, and Arsenal forward Bukayo Saka - the winner of the previous two editions - in third.

newsitem: Palmer voted England fans’ Player of the Year
Palmer voted England fans’ Player of the Year
Palmer voted England fans’ Player of the Year
description: Palmer made his England debut in a 2-0 home win over Malta in November 2023 and has gone on to earn nine senior caps, including five appearances at Euro 2024, scoring twice in that period.

newsitem: Palmer voted England fans’ Player of the Year
description: One of his goals came in July's final defeat to Spain in Berlin, after he set up Ollie Watkins for a late winner against the Netherlands in the semi-final.

newsitem: Palmer voted England fans’ Player of the Year
description: Palmer, who has scored six goals in seven Premier League games this season, became the first Chelsea player to win the award since current England assistant coach Ashley Cole in 2010.

newsitem: Palmer voted England fans’ Player of the Year
Palmer voted England fans’ Player of the Year
Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
title: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief in first job after Liverpool

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: German coach Juergen Klopp has been appointed head of global football for Red Bull, owners of several clubs including RB Leipzig and New York Red Bulls, the company said on Wednesday, in his first job since leaving Liverpool earlier this year.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: Klopp, who ended his successful nine-year stint with Liverpool at the end of last season, will be starting on January 1, 2025.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: "After almost 25 years on the sideline, I could not be more excited to get involved in a project like this," Klopp, who also coached Mainz 05 and Borussia Dortmund, said in a statement.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: "The role may have changed but my passion for football and the people who make the game what it is has not."

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: The 57-year-old joined Liverpool in October 2015 and won the Champions League, their first English League title since 1990, the Club World Cup, FA Cup, League Cup and Super Cup, as well as the Community Shield during his time in charge.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: Klopp, who also led Dortmund to two Bundesliga titles, a German Cup and a Champions League final in 2013, had announced in January he would be leaving Liverpool at the end of the season.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: He said on social media while he did not see himself working on the sidelines anymore he was ready to get back to work in another capacity.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: "I still love football and I still love working and Red Bull gives me the perfect platform for that," Klopp said in a video on Instagram.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: "I want to share my experience... I want to learn again, because when you are in the job and play every three days you barely have time for that, and now I have time. I want to see, feel, figure out what is useful for football," he added.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: Klopp will not be involved in the day-to-day operations of the Red Bull-owned clubs in Germany, United States, Brazil and Austria, the company said.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: "He will provide strategic vision, supporting individual sporting directors in advancing the Red Bull philosophy," Red Bull said.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: Klopp will also support the organisation’s global scouting operation, and contribute to the training and development of coaches.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: "I see my role primarily as a mentor for the coaches and management of the Red Bull clubs but ultimately I am one part of an organisation that is unique, innovative and forward looking. As I said, this could not excite me more," Klopp said.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: Some German media reported his Red Bull contract included an exit clause for the post of Germany national team coach.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
description: Klopp has long been linked to that job, especially after his successful stint at Liverpool and with Germany struggling to make an impact on the international stage in the past decade.

newsitem: Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
Klopp becomes Red Bull global football chief
Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
title: Worn-down Nadal to draw curtain on stellar career

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: Spain's Rafa Nadal, who won 22 Grand Slam singles titles, said on Thursday he was putting an end to his career, a decision effective after the Davis Cup final after a professional journey that made him one of the greatest players in tennis.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: "It has been some difficult years, these last two especially," the 38-year-old, who won a record 14 French Open titles, said in a video.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: "I am very excited that my last tournament will be the Davis Cup representing my country. It's closing the circle because one of my first joys was the final in Sevilla in 2004."

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: The Davis Cup knockout phase will be played from Nov. 19-24.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: Nadal's career has been hampered by injuries and he missed the 2023 French Open and was beaten in the first round by German Alexander Zverev this year.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: The 'King of Clay' won his last Roland Garros title in 2022 and left Paris on a jaw-dropping 112-4 win-loss record.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: Nadal played only 23 matches in the last two seasons.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: He will hang up his racket two years after his great rival Roger Federer, leaving 24-time major winner Novak Djokovic of Serbia as the only member of the 'Big Three' still active.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: Earlier on Thursday, Nadal's rival in the youngsters' ranks, Frenchman Richard Gasquet, said he would end his career after next year's French Open.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: Nadal thanked his family and his team for his stellar career, with a special word for his uncle Toni, who was his coach for most of his time on court.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: "I believe that thanks to him, I have also been able to overcome many situations that have been difficult in my sporting career," he said.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: To his fans, Nadal said: "I can't thank you enough for what you have made me feel. Everything I have experienced has been a dream come true."

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: "I leave with the absolute peace of mind having given my best," he added.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
description: After refusing any special event after his French Open first-round loss this year, Nadal said he would be back and he is now expected to receive what promises to be an emotional tribute at Roland Garros next year.

newsitem: Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
Tennis legend Nadal announces retirement
United's Mazraoui undergoes heart procedure
title: Man United's Mazraoui undergoes heart procedure, expected to return in next few weeks

newsitem: United's Mazraoui undergoes heart procedure
description: Manchester United defender Noussair Mazraoui has undergone a corrective heart procedure after experiencing palpitations but is expected to be available to play in the next few weeks, according to team sources.

newsitem: United's Mazraoui undergoes heart procedure
description: Mazraoui withdrew on Monday from the Morocco squad for two Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers against the Central African Republic on Saturday and Tuesday.

newsitem: United's Mazraoui undergoes heart procedure
description: The 26-year-old has started all seven of United's Premier League games this season and nine of the 10 matches he has been available for after arriving from Bayern Munich in August.

newsitem: United's Mazraoui undergoes heart procedure
description: He came off at halftime in United's 0-0 draw with Aston Villa on Sunday.

newsitem: United's Mazraoui undergoes heart procedure
description: United have a number of defenders currently absent with Harry Maguire, Luke Shaw and Tyrell Malacia sidelined with injuries.

newsitem: United's Mazraoui undergoes heart procedure
United's Mazraoui undergoes heart procedure
S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
title: South Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten in World Cup qualifying

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: South Korea beat Jordan 2-0 in Amman on Thursday to move top of Group B in the third round of Asia's World Cup preliminaries as Australia won their first match under new coach Tony Popovic.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: Goals from Lee Jae-sung and Oh Hyeong-gu gave underfire coach Hong Myung-bo his second win in a row and lifted the Koreans on to seven points from three matches.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: Hong had been booed after Korea's opening 0-0 draw with Palestine in Seoul but back-to-back wins mean the Taeguk Warriors are in a strong position to continue their record of qualifying for every World Cup since 1986.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: A header from Lee gave South Korea, missing injured captain Son Heung-min, the lead in the 38th minute and Oh doubled the advantage 23 minutes into the second half when he wrong-footed Yazeed Abulaila to score from inside the area.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: In Group A, Uzbekistan were unable to find a way past Iran's defence despite the visitors having only 10 players for the final 35 minutes of their top-of-the-table clash as they played out a 0-0 draw in Tashkent.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: Defender Saleh Hardani was shown a red card 10 minutes into the second half for a dangerous tackle on Uzbekistan captain Eldor Shomurodov.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: Australia picked up their first win of the campaign at the third attempt as Popovic led them to a 3-1 victory over China in Adelaide in his first game since replacing Graham Arnold as coach.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: Home-town favourite Craig Goodwin powered home a long-range strike in the 53rd minute after setting up Australia's first goal just before halftime with a free kick that was headed in by Lewis Miller to cancel out Xie Wenneng's opener.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: Nishan Velupillay made sure of the win on his international debut with a stoppage-time goal.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: The win revived Australia's chances of finishing the third phase of qualifying with a top-two spot and an automatic ticket to the 2026 finals.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: China, who have conceded 12 goals in their three qualifiers, remained winless in Group C.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: The top two in each group advance automatically to the World Cup while the third and fourth-placed sides go into another round of preliminaries.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: Group C leaders Japan take on Saudi Arabia in Jeddah later on Thursday and Bahrain will host Indonesia.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten
description: Asian Cup holders Qatar face Kyrgyzstan in Group A, where North Korea meet the United Arab Emirates. Iraq play Palestine in Group B and Oman take on Kuwait.

newsitem: S Korea down Jordan to remain unbeaten

Greece shock England in 2-1 win
title: Pavlidis double seals famous win for Greece over England

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: Greece beat England for the first time as striker Vangelis Pavlidis's double earned the visitors a richly-deserved 2-1 victory to put them in control of Nations League Group B2 at Wembley on Thursday.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: While Pavlidis's winner in the fourth minute of stoppage time sparked wild celebrations amongst the Greek fans, England's were left stunned as stand-in manager Lee Carsley got a sobering reality check.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: Two victories since Gareth Southgate stood down had raised Carsley's stock as a likely full-time replacement, but after this ragged defeat, his hopes may have dwindled.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: Pavlidis had given his side the lead early in the second half with a clinical finish and Greece had three goals ruled out against an England side that started with an experimental-looking attacking formation but misfired badly.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: Jude Bellingham looked to have rescued his side when he lashed home an 87th-minute equaliser with England's second shot on target, but there was another twist as the outstanding Pavlidis punished some woeful defending to shoot past Jordan Pickford from close range.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: Greece topped the table with a maximum nine points while England's first defeat under Carsley left them second with six.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: Carsley, who was without injured captain Harry Kane, stood by his decision to start without a recognised striker in a five-man attack, although he admitted it had failed.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: "I think with the players we have, we have to be courageous with our systems and be creative," he told reporters. "It was my idea and I take the blame for that. It definitely didn't come off but we shouldn't rule out trying something different."

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: POIGNANT EVENING

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: It was a poignant evening for Greece with a minute's silence held before kickoff for their former international George Baldock who died, aged 31, this week.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: "It a very special day and match for us. Our thoughts are with George (Baldock). But we are professionals and had to play the match," Pavlidis said. "We gave our soul for him tonight. Today is not a day to talk about football."

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: After the often conservative nature of England's football under Southgate there was a buzz of anticipation around Wembley as Carsley, who has been put in charge for the Nations League games, picked in-form Cole Palmer.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: The Chelsea player, who scored England's equaliser in the Euro 2024 final defeat against Spain as a substitute, started just behind force nine Bellingham and Phil Foden.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: UEFA Nations League - Group B2 - England v Greece - Wembley Stadium, London, Britain - Oct 10, 2024 England's Jude Bellingham looks dejected after Greece's Vangelis Pavlidis scores their second goal REUTERS/Toby Melville

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: UEFA Nations League - Group B2 - England v Greece - Wembley Stadium, London, Britain - Oct 10, 2024 England's Jude Bellingham looks dejected after Greece's Vangelis Pavlidis scores their second goal REUTERS/Toby Melville

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: Bellingham stung Greek keeper Vlachodimos Odysseas's fingers with a ferocious dipping drive and Palmer blazed wastefully over the crossbar when well-placed.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: But for all England's attacking potential, it was Greece who had the better first-half opportunities.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: Pavlidis curled one effort wide before home keeper Pickford almost gifted Greece the lead, losing the ball on the edge of his area and having his blushes spared by a brilliant goal-line clearance by Levi Colwill.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: UEFA Nations League - Group B2 - England v Greece - Wembley Stadium, London, Britain - Oct 10, 2024 Greece fans celebrate after the match Action Images via Reuters/Paul Childs

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: UEFA Nations League - Group B2 - England v Greece - Wembley Stadium, London, Britain - Oct 10, 2024 Greece fans celebrate after the match Action Images via Reuters/Paul Childs

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: Pickford then flapped at a high ball and Konstantinos Mavropanos headed into the net but was ruled offside.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: England began the second half in lethargic fashion and Greece took the lead in the 49th minute as Pavlidis showed great footwork to dispatch a low shot past Pickford despite being hemmed in by England defenders.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: Giorgos Masouras and Pavlidis then had goals ruled out by VAR and many England fans had already headed for home by the time Bellingham's shot beat Odyyseas Vlachodimos.

newsitem: Greece shock England in 2-1 win
Greece shock England in 2-1 win
description: Greece were undaunted though and Pavlidis made sure of victory at the 10th attempt against England.

Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
title: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model and humble idol for fellow pros

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: With 22 Grand Slam titles in the bag, the said he is at peace with his decision to hang up his racket after the Davis Cup next month.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: As Rafa Nadal prepares to ride off into the sunset after a stellar career, his fellow professionals from eras old and new agree on one thing - the Spaniard remains an inspirational role model whose legacy has shaped tennis over the last 23 years.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: With 22 Grand Slam titles in the bag, including a record 14 at Roland Garros where he was virtually unbeatable, 38-year-old Nadal said he is at peace with his decision to hang up his racket after the Davis Cup next month.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: Nadal has won the Davis Cup four times and he will bow out on home turf where he will team up with his protege Carlos Alcaraz, the proverbial prince and reigning French Open champion ready to inherit the crown from the 'King of Clay'.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: As a child Alcaraz had watched Nadal and was grateful for the "immense gift" of playing alongside him at the Paris Olympics earlier this year which was held at Roland Garros.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: "I couldn't believe it when I watched it... It was tough to accept it. I was in shock a little bit," Alcaraz told reporters at the Shanghai Masters.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: "It is really difficult news for everybody and even tougher for me. He has been my idol since I start playing tennis. I look up to him. Proudly, thanks to him, I really wanted to become a professional tennis player.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: Paris 2024 Olympics - Tennis - Men's Doubles Second Round - Roland-Garros Stadium, Paris, France - July 30, 2024. Carlos Alcaraz of Spain and Rafael Nadal of Spain react during their match against Tallon Griekspoor of Netherlands and Wesley Koolhof of Netherlands. REUTERS

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: Paris 2024 Olympics - Tennis - Men's Doubles Second Round - Roland-Garros Stadium, Paris, France - July 30, 2024. Carlos Alcaraz of Spain and Rafael Nadal of Spain react during their match against Tallon Griekspoor of Netherlands and Wesley Koolhof of Netherlands. REUTERS

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: "Losing him, in a certain way, is going to be difficult for us, so I will try to enjoy as much as I can when he's going to play (and) enjoy the time with him as much as I can. But it is a shame for tennis and for me."

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: His 'Big Three' rival Novak Djokovic played him 60 times, winning 31, and the Serbian said Nadal's greatest achievement was inspiring millions of children to pick up the sport.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: "Your tenacity, dedication, fighting spirit is going to be taught for decades. Your legacy will live forever. Only you know what you had to endure to become icon of tennis and sport in general," added Djokovic, a 24-times major winner.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: "Thank you for pushing me to the very limit so many times in our rivalry that has impacted me the most as a player."

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: 'STAY HUMBLE'

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: World number one Jannik Sinner said Nadal's announcement was a bitter pill to swallow and that he was "very lucky" to have got to know him on the Tour, adding that the younger generation learned from Nadal's values and on-court etiquette.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: "We all saw how good he has been as a player, the lessons he taught us, the young players, how to behave on the court, how to handle situations on the court, tough situations. He gave to all of us a lot of emotions when we saw him playing," Sinner said.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: "And also to stay humble at the same time, not changing with the success, choosing the right people around him, having a great family. There are so many great things he gave to all of us.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: "Obviously it's tough, but in another way everything has a beginning and also an ending."

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: Rafael Nadal of Spain (R) is embraced by Roger Federer of Switzerland after defeating him in their finals match at the Wimbledon tennis championships in London July 6, 2008. REUTERS

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: Rafael Nadal of Spain (R) is embraced by Roger Federer of Switzerland after defeating him in their finals match at the Wimbledon tennis championships in London July 6, 2008. REUTERS

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: Ons Jabeur and Maria Sakkari thanked Nadal for inspiring them along with 20-year-old American Coco Gauff, who was not even born when he turned professional.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: "You are amazing! It's been so incredible to witness your greatness and work ethic and be able to learn from it," the world number four said on social media.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: But perhaps no player has seen the best of Nadal more than Swiss great Roger Federer as the two forged an epic rivalry across all surfaces that elevated the sport to stratospheric levels.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: Although they were eternal rivals on the Tour, they were close friends off the court and Nadal teamed up with Federer for the final match of his career two years ago at the Laver Cup.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: "What a career, Rafa! I always hoped this day would never come," Federer said.

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
description: "Thank you for the unforgettable memories and all your incredible achievements in the game we love. It's been an absolute honour!"

newsitem: Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
Retiring Nadal remains an inspiring role model for fellow pros
Venezuela hold Argentina to 1-1 draw on Messi's return
title: Venezuela hold Argentina to 1-1 draw on Messi's return

newsitem: Venezuela hold Argentina to 1-1 draw on Messi's return
description: Argentina were held to a 1-1 draw against Venezuela on Thursday in Lionel Messi's return to international duty in South America's World Cup qualifiers.

newsitem: Venezuela hold Argentina to 1-1 draw on Messi's return
description: Captain Messi, 37, fully recovered from an injury sustained in the Copa America final against Colombia in July, was brilliant in setting up Otamendi on a drenched pitch to open the scoring 13 minutes after kick-off, which was delayed by half an hour due to heavy rain.

newsitem: Venezuela hold Argentina to 1-1 draw on Messi's return
description: A fierce Venezuela equalised in the second half when Salomon Rondon's header from Yeferson Soteldo's pass beat goalkeeper Geronimo Rulli, who filled in for Emiliano 'Dibu' Martinez as he is serving a two-match ban for offensive behaviour.

newsitem: Venezuela hold Argentina to 1-1 draw on Messi's return
description: Argentina remain top of the standings with 19 points and will face Bolivia on Tuesday, while Venezuela, who moved up to sixth on 11 points, visit Paraguay.

newsitem: Venezuela hold Argentina to 1-1 draw on Messi's return
Venezuela hold Argentina to 1-1 draw on Messi's return
Venezuela hold Argentina to 1-1 draw on Messi's return
Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
title: Last-gasp Luiz Henrique effort gives Brazil 2-1 win at Chile

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: Lacklustre Brazil pulled off a last-gasp 2-1 away victory over Chile in the South American World Cup qualifiers on Thursday, thanks to a goal by substitute Luiz Henrique in the 89th minute.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: Off the back of a disappointing loss to Paraguay and losing four of their last five qualifiers with a series of poor performances, Brazil had to recover from a goal down as Eduardo Vargas put the locals in front with a fine header from a Felipe Loyola cross in the second minute.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: Chile wasted chances to extend their lead, but Brazil managed to find the equaliser in added time before the break, when Savinho made a good run down the right and crossed to Igor Jesus who nodded a towering header past the goalkeeper, scoring on his first call-up for the national team.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: Brazil controlled the second half and found a duly deserved winner late with a fine effort by Jesus' teammate at Brazilian league leaders and Copa Libertadores semi-finalists Botafogo Luiz Henrique, who slotted a curling strike from the edge of the box to rescue the five-time World Cup champions three much needed points.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: The victory lifted Brazil to fourth in the standings with 13 points, two behind Uruguay and eight from leaders Argentina. Chile are second from bottom on five points.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: Earlier on Thursday, leaders Argentina were held to a 1-1 draw against Venezuela in Lionel Messi's return to international duty from an injury.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: The Argentine captain brilliantly assisted Nicolas Otamendi on a drenched pitch to open the scoring 13 minutes after kick-off, but a relentless Venezuela fought back to equalise with a Salomon Rondon's header in the second half.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: In-form Bolivia grabbed a gritty 1-0 win, their third successive victory, handing second-placed Colombia their first loss in the qualifiers.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: Trying to end a 13-game winless run against their opponents, Bolivia started well but had to play most of the game with 10 men as Hector Cuellar was sent off with a straight red card for bringing striker Roger Martinez down as the last man in the 20th minute.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: However, the fierce locals managed to find the winner in a stunning strike by Miguel Terceros, who dominated near the right touchline, cutting inside to beat two Colombian defenders before unleashing a fine left-footed strike that flew into the top-left corner in the 58th minute.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: Argentina are on top of the standings on 19 points, three ahead of Colombia and four from third-place Uruguay, who have a game in hand and will face last-placed Peru on Friday.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: Brazil climbed to fourth, leapfrogging Ecuador, who are in fifth place on 12 points following a goalless draw against Paraguay.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
description: Bolivia are behind Ecuador on goal difference in sixth, followed by Venezuela with a point behind in seventh. Only the top six are guaranteed a berth at the 2026 finals.

newsitem: Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile

Luiz Henrique fires Brazil to 2-1 win over Chile
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
title: England thump Pakistan by innings and 47 runs for historic Test win

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: England, riding on the sublime batting of Harry Brook and Joe Root, became the first team to win a Test by an innings after conceding more than 500 runs in the first stanza, sealing the victory early on the fifth day of the series opener on Friday.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: After a record-breaking day in which the duo helped England post a colossal 823-7 before the bowlers ran through Pakistan's top order, the tourists completed an extraordinary innings and 47-run victory well before lunch.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: With Pakistan's Abrar Ahmed not batting due to illness, England reduced the hosts to 220-9 after some early resistance as Jack Leach bagged the three wickets needed and sparked huge celebrations among a small but vocal group of travelling fans.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: While the bowlers completed the job, it was a stupendous batting effort that set up the win after man-of-the-match Brook scored 317 and Root made 262 in a partnership that ground the hosts to dust.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: First Test - England v Pakistan - Multan Cricket Stadium, Multan, Pakistan - Oct 10, 2024 England's Brydon Carse celebrates with teammates after taking a catch to dismiss Pakistan's Saim Ayub caught by Ben Duckett REUTERS/Akhtar Soomro

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: First Test - England v Pakistan - Multan Cricket Stadium, Multan, Pakistan - Oct 10, 2024 England's Brydon Carse celebrates with teammates after taking a catch to dismiss Pakistan's Saim Ayub caught by Ben Duckett REUTERS/Akhtar Soomro

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: "We knew the way to win this game was to put a mammoth score on the board," England's stand-in skipper Ollie Pope said.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: "I think that's credit to (Brook and Root) for the skills they've got with the bat, the determination they had to put the team in a winning position. So it was awesome."

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: Pakistan resumed on a precarious 152-6 and Salman Agha was the first to depart in the morning after a defiant 63, with the introduction of Leach helping England snap his 109-run stand with Aamer Jamal.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: England's pace bowlers peppered the two overnight batsmen with bouncers earlier and Jamal recovered after being hit on the side of the head by a fiery ball from Brydon Carse to bring up his own half-century.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: He was then granted a lifeline when Pope dropped a tough chance at square-leg - England's fifth dropped catch of the innings - and was not out on 55 when he ran out of partners.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: Leach pulled off a stunning catch off his own bowling to remove Shaheen Afridi, before having Naseem Shah stumped to finish with figures of 4-30.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: England declared after their highest total in 86 years and extracted the most from a lifeless pitch at the Multan Cricket Stadium to rattle Pakistan on Thursday.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: First Test - England v Pakistan - Multan Cricket Stadium, Multan, Pakistan - Oct 10, 2024 England's Harry Brook and Joe Root in action REUTERS/Akhtar Soomro

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: First Test - England v Pakistan - Multan Cricket Stadium, Multan, Pakistan - Oct 10, 2024 England's Harry Brook and Joe Root in action REUTERS/Akhtar Soomro

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: 'ANOTHER CHANCE'

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: The hosts flexed their muscles in the early part of the Test with 556 in the first innings, but found themselves under the gun, trailing England by 115 runs at the end of the fourth day and they eventually folded under pressure.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: Pakistan's tally was the joint third-highest first-innings total in a losing cause and marked the first time in more than 700 Tests in Asia that a team had lost after making 500-plus runs in the first innings.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs
description: Skipper Shan Masood said his team were pained after their sixth straight loss and sought a strong response when the sides meet in the second of three matches next Tuesday.

newsitem: England thump Pakistan by an innings and 47 runs

title: Djokovic expecting endurance battle with Sinner in Shanghai final

newsitem:

											The 24-times Grand Slam champion will play his fifth final in the tournament's history
description: Novak Djokovic expects nothing less than a titanic duel with world number one Jannik Sinner in the Shanghai Masters final on Sunday after defeating American seventh seed Taylor Fritz 6-4, 7-6(6) in the semi-finals.

newsitem:

description: Djokovic, the 24-times Grand Slam champion, will play his fifth final in the tournament's history, looking to claim his 100th ATP title as well as his fifth Shanghai Masters crown.

description: It will be a rematch of this year’s Australian Open semi-final, where eventual champion Sinner ended Djokovic’s 33-match winning streak with a 6-1, 6-2, 6-7(6), 6-3 upset win.

description: Djokovic, who had committed 54 unforced errors, was stunned by Sinner's performance during the three-hour 26-minute battle in January but is confident he will prevail this time.
